description: Default Batch ID is required. Assign Batch ID to a set of Flexible Payment and Deduction Events.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

description: Flexible Payment and Deduction Options Event Data

validation.validation: Specify a Payment Period that is not outside the date range [Effective Start] - [Effective End].
validation.description: Specify a Payment Period that is not outside the date range Effective Start date - Effective End Date.

validation.validation: You can't request this Payment or Deduction Type. Today's date is outside its Request Between dates.
validation.description: You can't request this Payment or Deduction Type. Today's date is outside its Request Between dates.

validation.validation: Specify an active Payment or Deduction Type.
validation.description: Specify an active Payment or Deduction Type.

validation.validation: Specify a Deduction Amount that is less than or equal to the Granted Amount.
validation.description: Specify a Deduction Amount that is less than or equal to the Granted Amount.

validation.validation: Specify a Deduction Period that is not complete and is valid for the pay group of the worker's position.
validation.description: Specify a Deduction Period that is not complete and is valid for the pay group of the worker's position.

validation.validation: You can't specify a Payment Period. This Payment or Deduction Type can only be deducted from the worker's pay.
validation.description: You can't specify a Payment Period. This Payment or Deduction Type can only be deducted from the worker's pay.

validation.validation: Specify a Payment Period that is not complete and is valid for the pay group of the worker's position.
validation.description: Specify a Payment Period that is not complete and is valid for the pay group of the worker's position.

validation.validation: Specify a Payment Period that is not before [Effective Start].
validation.description: Specify a Payment Period that's not before the effective start date.

validation.validation: This Payment or Deduction Type isn't available in the worker's country.
validation.description: This Payment or Deduction Type isn't available in the worker's country.

validation.validation: Specify a Deduction Start Period that is not before the Payment Period.
validation.description: Specify a Deduction Start Period that is not before the Payment Period.

validation.validation: You can't submit a request of this type. [employee] already has an active request for [type].
validation.description: You can't submit a request of this type. Employee already has an active request for type.

validation.validation: Specify a Granted Amount that is less than or equal to [maximum amount].
validation.description: Specify a Granted Amount that is less than or equal to maximum amount.

validation.validation: Specify a Granted Amount that is between [minimum amount] and [maximum amount].
validation.description: Specify a Granted Amount that is between minimum amount and maximum amount.

validation.validation: Specify a Granted Amount that is greater than or equal to [minimum amount].
validation.description: Specify a Granted Amount that is greater than or equal to minimum amount.

validation.validation: The field Payment Period is required and must have a value.
validation.description: The field Payment Period is required and must have a value.

validation.validation: Specify a Payment Period that is not after [Effective End Date].
validation.description: Specify a Payment Period that is not after Effective End Date.

validation.validation: Specify a Deduction Amount with no more than 2 digits after the decimal point.
validation.description: Specify a Deduction Amount with no more than 2 digits after the decimal point.

validation.validation: Specify a Granted Amount with no more than 2 digits after the decimal point.
validation.description: Specify a Granted Amount with no more than 2 digits after the decimal point.
